It is one of the best smartphone in this price range.There are many pros & cons.
  
  Pros:
  
  *The speed of the phone is just amazing. 3GB RAM does it's job very well.
  
  *It looks premium and feels weightless.
  
  *Primary camera is awesome.
  
  *Android experience is very good.
  
  *Funtouch OS is lovely.
  

  Cons:
  
  *Low light photos look worse.
  
  *The phone charges slowly.
  
  *The quality of the front camera is just okay.
  
  *The sound quality is not up the level.
  

  Overall it is a tough competitor to the smartphones in this price range.

The phone is awesome.The camera both rear and front captures clear and quality pictures even in low light and the user can insert 2 sims and a memory card upto 256GB at a same time i.e free from hybrid slot problem.
  
  The phone delievers high purity sound from the speaker and for the earphone as well as for the big headphones.
  
  3GB Ram,Snapdragon 425 processor and 2730 mh battery but it doesn't have fast charging options.The phone comes with a screen guard, a wallcharger,datacable,descent earphones,silicon transparent backcover and sim ejector pin.
  
  I think the price is more as compared to its  features and specification but good and nice phone manufactured by Vivo Mobile Communications Co. Ltd.

It is one of the best smartphone in this price range.There are many pros & cons.
  
  Pros:
  
  *The speed of the phone is just amazing. 3GB RAM does it's job very well.
  
  *It looks premium and feels weightless.
  
  *Primary camera is awesome.
  
  *Android experience is very good.
  
  *Funtouch OS is lovely.
  

  Cons:
  
  *Low light photos look worse.
  
  *The phone charges slowly.
  
  *The quality of the front camera is just okay.
  
  *The sound quality is not up the level.
  

  Overall it is a tough competitor to the smartphones in this price range.

Used product for 4 days, got this in 14K under exchange, overall nice phone, selfie was awesome.
  
  Smooth execution much fast to handle multiple apps. Slim and nice looks.
  

  Only drawback I found is it can only run one sim on 4G network at a time. Only sim from which you enable mobile data will be switched to 4G network automatically, so if we have jio sim and enabled data from another sim, jio sim will lost network. I deduct 1point because of this issue in phone.
  

  Please keep this point in mind before purchasing. If this doesn't matter for you this is best phone if buy under 16-17K.

column6: Dual Sim but only one sim is practically Active
column7:
If you are on a call on sim1 and the other person calls on sim2  you will not get call waiting or any intimation and for the other person it says you are not reachable. You might miss out important calls on the other sim if you are active on one sim.
  
  Cheap Chinese products have dual active sim phones but somehow this big brand has left this tiny little feature that makes dual sim active.
  

  Dual standby vs dual active: what's the difference?
  

  But not all dual SIM Android phones were created equal.
  

  There are mainly two types of dual SIM Android phones: dual standby and dual active.
  

  The difference is NOT small.
  

  Dual Active means both SIM cards can connect (listen) to their own mobile networks. These two SIM cards in the same phone can even be from one carrier. In this case, both are connected to the same mobile network independently, just like from two different phones.
  

  However, in dual standby Android phones, there is only one set of hardware (mainly receiver)  to serve two SIM cards. In other words, two SIM cards share one set of hardware through time sharing algorithms implemented in the software level.
  

  For dual active Android phones, there are usually two sets of receivers. Each SIM card uses its own receiver.
  

  Vivo Coudn't afford this kind of technology in their flagship phones like VIVO V5 plus that a smallest Chinese phone can adopt.

Worst service support provided by flipkart. Had to order the phone again. Delivery boy committed a false statement to comeback in 30 mins for exchange. Neither he came back nor told his correct information about his plans for delivery. Surprisingly, the first order ggot automatically rejected. Ordered again and then the exchange was processed flawlessly. Customer care executives are totally useless. They have no authority to take any corrective action. Despite their several escalations, nothing happened. They committed to resolve the delivery issue in 3 days. But by next morning the order rejection and refund was completed. Hence, nothing could be done. Eventually had to order again.
  
  Product is OK. Touch is a bit sluggish. Scrolling is not smooth. While scrolling, sometimes links open (which you don't intend to open). Not worth of 25K. One plus is a far far better option. Have been using it since 1.5 years. No issues at all.
  
  Overall experience : 1 out 10

I purchased this phone from a retailer. My expectations were low and it has exceeded them. So, its not a bad phone at all.
  

  Pros:
  
  -Interface is interesting with a touch of iOS.
  
  -I purchased this phone in August, 2016. No lagging issues yet.
  
  -No Heating issues.
  
  -Battery Backup depends on your usage. It has super saver mode which I opt for when the battery is less than 5%. It last for upto an hour then.
  
  -Camera is better than average. It works well for a 5MP Camera. Secondary Camera with filters works well.
  
  -The highlight of the product would be its RAM. It functions way better than phones with a RAM of 2GB.
  
  -Many features such as air lock which is available in high end Samsung phones is present here.
  

  Cons:
  
  -There is a problem with low quality video pixelization in youtube. If the internet connection is strong, videos play well.
  
  -Sound quality is not mind blowing. I was using Sony Xperia E which had better sound performance.
  

  Overall verdict: If you are looking for a phone with the usage of about an year or two with light usage, its a  good phone. Please keep in mind that its not a 4G phone.

I ordered VIVO Y55L (gold, 16GB), mobile on 21st Dec'16 (order ID-OD407915731774307000; Seller- MOBILESONWHEELS) through flipkart prepaid by credit card. I am a regular customer of Flipkart but this time, I have a very bad experience with the flipkart. When I received the product and opened it, I got really shocked when I have found PIECES OF BRICKS PACKED IN A EMPTY PHILIPS SPEAKER BOX in the FLIPKART BOX with Sealed Packing instead of ordered product. The seller was different as when I ordered- BP SYSTEM & SOLUTIONS instead of MOBILESONWHEELS. I have immediately complained and requested through its website and customer care. (Return ID- 1010794093193625571). I had ordered several mobiles earlier including a iPhone also.Service of flipkart everytime impresses me and there were no complaint against the products it delivered. I dont know what will happen but I am very much disappointed with this experience.

column6: Perfect Smartphone at this Price Range. Thumbs Up. 5 Stars
column7:
1. 2350 mAh is just a number. Battery Life is something more than expected, simply great. No heating issues.
  
  2. Camera clarity is awesome, be it primary (8mp) or secondary (5mp). Clicks great pics, even in low light. Say NO to blur images now.
  
  3. 2gb RAM, No Lagging, Smooth Gaming Experience. 16 gb Inbuilt, 128 gb Expandable, install as many apps as you need.
  
  4. Speakers at the bottom. Great & Effective Sound Quality.
  
  5. 4g LTE connectivity, NO VoLTE. Still Great connectivity.
  
  6. HD Display, Royal Look, Android 5.0.2, iphone-like interface, lock screen, settings view and notification panel.
  
  7. Effective inbuilt apps e.g iManager for junk cleaning. Smart Screen, Smart Motion And Super Click features to name a few.
  

  Go For It ;)

column6: Not worth the price at all
column7:
Mediocre phone:
  

  - Resolution is low (pixel density is only 240ppi compared to ~300 in similar priced phones)
  
  - Battery capacity is only 2350 mAh (other similar costing phones have 2800 or more)
  
  - Charger is only 5 W which means slower charging (10W is the standard nowadays)
  

  Better go for other options.

Battery is 2300mh but I am using it one day by 100% recharge on doing 3g net. About  Other phones I can't say anything but this one has awesome battery back up. I'll mention the pros and cons of this phone and I'll give my verdict
  
  Pros
  
  Looks good with metal body
  

  Large display with decent resolution
  

  4 GB RAM
  

  Cons
  

  Hybrid SIM slot
  

  Average battery backup
  

  Bugs in the UI
  

  My verdict
  

  Vivo V3 Max is a decent smartphone owing to its cameras, metallic body and 4 GB RAM. But spec wise, it does not look that good at Rs 23,980, as some of its competitors even offer Quad HD resolution and a much better processor including Snapdragon 810. Thus, I would like to give it 6 points out of 10

I go this from a retailer about a month back and got a good deal (free data, cash back etc)
  

  - The display is good most times and offers excellent color reproduction. However legibility is just about average when out in the sun. Not bad though. Touch sensitivy is precise and i have had no isssues with it so far
  
  - Camera produces great results in good lighting conditions. Low light conditions the pictures are really sad. Very grainy. Also you need to have firm hands, else shakes are easily visible on the picture
  
  - Finger sensor is fantastic. extremely responsive and fast.
  
  - Buttons on the screen are not back lit. So you would need to get used to grooping
  
  - It comes with a notification light. However it does not give you options to change the color (it is green by default). If there are programs that offers you color options and you change it, the notification light does not glow
  
  - Sound quality is by far the best i have heard in a mobile device. I have a K4 note and thought that set the benchmark in this area. This ones beats it hands down. So audiophiles, this is the phone to look for
  
  - OS - this is quite sad to see an extremely customized version on android 5.1. It is quite rigid and does not offer enough flexibility. Also the device ships with an outdated version of Android (5.1) when MM has been around for close to a year now. Infact there are conversations of Androind N and Vivo still doesn't have line of sight for MM. Given that this runs on SD 652 with 4GB RAM, it still fares lesser on the Antutu charts compared to the 3GB version of LE 2. I got a 76k score.
  
  - Last and most importantly, customer support - I am sorry to say, this is something that Vivo thinks can get away with. All they say is as and when there is an update you will get a notification on the phone. Now that is a no-brainer. It is just unacceptable that this answer is given for any query you have. No one at Vivo have the faintest idea if this phone is ever going to get updated to later versions of Android
  

  Overall a great phone let down by the SW and the carefree and I-have-no-idea attitude of the support folks

column6: Too Many bugs in the OS
column7:
VIVO V3 is one good looking sturdy phone and it is very hard to find flaws when you take a look at its metal finish body, but I hope I could have said same for its OS also.
  

  Sad to say on the OS front, this phone is let down for flagship models. So if you are a user who uses his/her phone for more than calling here are the top bummers coming up and you should think thrice before buying this phone.
  


  * No Device-level encryption
  
  This is the biggest one. Though V3 funtouch OS is based on Android 5.1, they have deliberately removed the device level encryption. I had multiple chats with Vivo care, they confirm that this feature is not there. So if you loose your device, say don't be surpise if your data goes public on phising website.
  

  * No noise cancellation in calling (video) apps
  
  Bye bye! a headache free Video calling using the speaker phone (without handsfree). This phone as a massive software bug which let the phone speaker volume in the mic, (no noise cancellation) and the person at the other end will hear his own voice echo and by bad luck if the other person is also using VIVO V3, both phone will get into the endless voice feedback look and you will hear the microphone squeal and application will crash.
  


  * Chrome Casting also suffer from audio feedback loop
  
  If you by chance uses chrome cast, you are in bad luck because somehow if you cast a phone local content, it will not cast sound and also keep the mic open, so you mic will pick the sound coming out of speakers, send it to TV, then also pick put the sound coming from TV and send it back again. The positive audio amplification feedback loop will occur resulting in microphone squeal and eventual application crash.
  


  * No smart lock
  
  With android 4.4 Google came up with smart lock option which basically enables your phone to get kept unlock by you smart watch or otherBluetoothh device or if it is on your body. But Vivo has deliberately removed this feature. (because I think they wanted to be Apple-like). You can still enable this feature as a bug when you connect your phone first time, a notification will ask for the smart lock, but after that, you won't be able to access the smart lock screen from setting because it is not there.
  

  * Third party apps can't show music controls on locked screen
  
  Though the V3 phones are targetted to music lovers, but frankly speaking their built-in music application sucks, I have 22000 songs on my SD card, and Vivo "i Music" application takes almost 10 sec to start and their interface is quite uninteresting and unuseful. You can use the google music or Pulsar type third party app, but they won't be able to show the music control on lock screen. If you are a music lover you know what pain it will be.
  

  * No USB File sharing mode
  
  I have a large song library, so when I sync it using the MTP mode of the VIVO V3, it gives me frustration attack. Because the MTP connection is always been infamous of frequent disconnection and being slow.
  


  * They are trying hard to be a cheap iPhone
  
  With no app drawer in default launcher and application like "i Music", "i Manager", "i Theme", 13 MP camera, deliberately removed device encryption and smart lock feature, the pull up quick setting menu, it is not very hard to see VIVO is trying to copy Apple, but all it could have achieved is a cheap copy status. But they really forgot to use their brains in the copying process.
  


  No Marshmallow update
  
  Those who like to keep up with technology (or software updates) the biggest bummer is that their OS layer (funtouch OS 2.5) is still based on Android 5.1 which no timeline or confirmation for marshmallow (thinking of Android Nougat on this device is not realistic). The current OS has many unpolished edges, it will be the long list if I start to counting.
  

  Pathetic VIVO Care response
  
  I have raised all the issues with VIVO Care and their response with for all of the questions were Duo, skype, Google music and Google Cast etc are third party application and VIVO does not guaranty (or care) their compatibility with their device. Even their own V3 is facing the noise (un) cancellation on video calling, so I should learn to live with that.

Over hyped Chinese product.
  

  Phone appeals like an well build smartphone.
  

  Here is the cons & pros,
  

  Cons:
  
  1.Over hyped Chinese product,
  
  2.No Fast charging/2a charging adaptor,
  
  3.Not worth for even  8000 but priced over  14,000INR,
  
  4.Camera: both front & back takes snaps like an 2mp camera phone results in washed out pictures.
  
  5.No Multi Color LED notification,
  
  6.No 1080p display (at least), or AMOLED Display,
  
  7.No guaranteed future OS updates,
  
  8.Less mah battery capacity,
  
  9. Doesn't support various multimedia formats with higher resolution.
  

  Pros:
  
  1.look & Display ( no viewing angle issues),
  
  2.less bloatwares,
  
  3.2year warranty doesn't know how it'll work,
  
  4.No heating Issues while charging with both 1a & 2a chargers,
  
  5.fast fingerprint scanner.
  
  6.Has dedicated SD card slot,

column6: Too Many bugs in the OS
column7:
VIVO V3 is one good looking sturdy phone and it is very hard to find flaws when you take a look at its metal finish body, but I hope I could have said same for its OS also.
  

  Sad to say on the OS front, this phone is let down for flagship models. So if you are a user who uses his/her phone for more than calling here are the top bummers coming up and you should think thrice before buying this phone.
  


  * No Device-level encryption
  
  This is the biggest one. Though V3 funtouch OS is based on Android 5.1, they have deliberately removed the device level encryption. I had multiple chats with Vivo care, they confirm that this feature is not there. So if you loose your device, say don't be surpise if your data goes public on phising website.
  

  * No noise cancellation in calling (video) apps
  
  Bye bye! a headache free Video calling using the speaker phone (without handsfree). This phone as a massive software bug which let the phone speaker volume in the mic, (no noise cancellation) and the person at the other end will hear his own voice echo and by bad luck if the other person is also using VIVO V3, both phone will get into the endless voice feedback look and you will hear the microphone squeal and application will crash.
  


  * Chrome Casting also suffer from audio feedback loop
  
  If you by chance uses chrome cast, you are in bad luck because somehow if you cast a phone local content, it will not cast sound and also keep the mic open, so you mic will pick the sound coming out of speakers, send it to TV, then also pick put the sound coming from TV and send it back again. The positive audio amplification feedback loop will occur resulting in microphone squeal and eventual application crash.
  


  * No smart lock
  
  With android 4.4 Google came up with smart lock option which basically enables your phone to get kept unlock by you smart watch or otherBluetoothh device or if it is on your body. But Vivo has deliberately removed this feature. (because I think they wanted to be Apple-like). You can still enable this feature as a bug when you connect your phone first time, a notification will ask for the smart lock, but after that, you won't be able to access the smart lock screen from setting because it is not there.
  

  * Third party apps can't show music controls on locked screen
  
  Though the V3 phones are targetted to music lovers, but frankly speaking their built-in music application sucks, I have 22000 songs on my SD card, and Vivo "i Music" application takes almost 10 sec to start and their interface is quite uninteresting and unuseful. You can use the google music or Pulsar type third party app, but they won't be able to show the music control on lock screen. If you are a music lover you know what pain it will be.
  

  * No USB File sharing mode
  
  I have a large song library, so when I sync it using the MTP mode of the VIVO V3, it gives me frustration attack. Because the MTP connection is always been infamous of frequent disconnection and being slow.
  


  * They are trying hard to be a cheap iPhone
  
  With no app drawer in default launcher and application like "i Music", "i Manager", "i Theme", 13 MP camera, deliberately removed device encryption and smart lock feature, the pull up quick setting menu, it is not very hard to see VIVO is trying to copy Apple, but all it could have achieved is a cheap copy status. But they really forgot to use their brains in the copying process.
  


  No Marshmallow update
  
  Those who like to keep up with technology (or software updates) the biggest bummer is that their OS layer (funtouch OS 2.5) is still based on Android 5.1 which no timeline or confirmation for marshmallow (thinking of Android Nougat on this device is not realistic). The current OS has many unpolished edges, it will be the long list if I start to counting.
  

  Pathetic VIVO Care response
  
  I have raised all the issues with VIVO Care and their response with for all of the questions were Duo, skype, Google music and Google Cast etc are third party application and VIVO does not guaranty (or care) their compatibility with their device. Even their own V3 is facing the noise (un) cancellation on video calling, so I should learn to live with that.
 
 

   READ MORE

column3: VIVO V5s Perfect Selfie (Energetic Blue, 64 GB)
column7:
I'm writing the review after 5 hours of rigrous use of the phone
  

  Pro
  
  1. Awesome display
  
  2. Excellent front cam with perfect moonlight along with rear cam
  
  3. Memory storage too good(54GB) usable
  
  4. Excellent swapping in between application
  
  5. Split screen
  

  Cons
  
  1. Android Marshmallow OS with no recent update to Android Naught
  
  2. Battery backup weak in comparison to Moto X's play,Sony Xperia Z2, Samsung J7 Max n On Pro
  


  But gave a 5 * rating due to awesome Cam ROM n storage along with Speedy fast delivery of product( Delivered at home inspite of Floody Roads n Heavy Rainfall)
  
  Simply amazing

column3: VIVO V5s Perfect Selfie (Energetic Blue, 64 GB)
column7:
Been using this phone for 2 months now. Worst performance phone.
  
  1. Battery backup is horrible. Even if the data or wifi is off battery drains quickly.
  
  2. Hangs a lot. You open 4-5 apps phone just hangs
  
  3. Software issues. If you try to call a number from your contacts it will dial some other number from you contacts. So if this happens I need to reboot my phone repeatedly
  
  4. The buy back option from Flipkart is just a marketing strategy just waste of money. Trying to get rid of this phone and now I don't see any option of this vivo phone in almost many of the new phones exchange offers.
  
  5. 20 megapixel camera is just name sake. You can buy better phones at this price.
 
 

   READ MORE

column6: Amazing Product with Amazing Price... Go and Get it.. Vivo
column7:
My Review
  
  1. Very nice amazing Vivo 5s , it looks similar to iPhone and have features as well.
  
  2. Front camera 20 megapixel is really super quality with flash.
  
  3. Very fast processing and very user friendly.
  
  4. Rear camera 13 megapixel is just OK and not so awesome.
  
  5. Battery backup is also average.
  
  6. Other features like screen lock , sensor, music look wise is awesome.
  
  7. Storage is very good 64 GB. RAM is also good 4GB.
  
  8. 2D glass is also very good.
  

  Overall with this price its very good mobile, I purchased in exchange offer and BIG10 sale offer so it reduced 40% of cost .

column3: VIVO V5s Perfect Selfie (Energetic Blue, 64 GB)
column7:
Absolutely superb. Limited edition blue handset which I could find only on flipkart. They delivered in on time. Gave me a 10% cash back later since they could not do it as per the commitment during the transaction. This is the second phone I bought from flipkart.
  

  Now about the phone ViVo V5s
  
  It gives you best in range features at this price. Camera quality is all worth the hype. Audio recorder is also fab. Above all, the phone looks beautiful.
  

  Jus a small but missing is that you can either have dual sim or a memory card. However with a 64 gb phone memory I doubt if there would be any external memory need.

column3: VIVO V5s Perfect Selfie (Energetic Blue, 64 GB)
column7:
I have bought this phone recently and what I observed is that it's not worth spending money on this device unless you use it only for selfie and trust me there are more cons than pros as we discuss in detail
  
  Pros :
  
  Big display with bright screen and good resolution support
  
  Performance not bad
  
  Back panel is bit rugged so it won't slip of so easily from your grip
  
  Photo effects are nice
  
  Cons :
  
  Selfies are not so great though it was specially meant for it as you zoom the pixels look so awkward especially if it is a night mode
  
  Main camera is more worse than a normal phone
  
  Battery backup would have been made better
  
  Really big phone that takes quality of space in your pocket and holding it for long periods is a night mare
  
  Considering the above facts not worth more than 8k for this mobile
 
 

   READ MORE

  Camera quality with 13MP and 20MP would have been much better so I give Good rating - 3
  
  Processing speed is Very Good - 4.
  
  Overall Performance is Very Good - 4.
